rComments: He was a pretty good teacher - listened to the students' evaluations from the middle of the quarter, which helped improve the class. The variety of students in the GE classes make responses really varied - as a science major I thought he was very clear and concise. Spent a little too much time discussing project dues, not enough on the subject.

useless professor & class. the title of the class sounds appealing (renewable / sustainable energy sources), but it's a boring class. don't take it. hope you don't get any one like the annoying guy in our class that tried to impress the professor with stupid questions that had nothing to do with class. it was nice to see him get shot down by prof!

He was fairly rude to students and unhelpful. In Renewable Energy I learned not a single thing about renewable energy except that basically all of them will not work. He was extremely negative. Also, there was no final so there was no reason to read the text book, which I never opened.

i can't understand him!! he bumbles on and on and asks the class for "burning questions." he comes off as kind of arrogant, but it could be a cultural difference. his ta's are pretty useless, specially chris bacon. oxana is chill. she shows you all the cool demos, the professor lectures about mostly boring stuff, and chris bacon flings bs at you

From the perspective of a current EE major, I don't think he explains the physics behind what he teaches very effectively. He often makes mistakes, that to him are trivial, but I get the impression that a lot of the non-science majors are genuinely confused as a result of his slip ups. Math and science majors be warned, plenty of hand waving!

This class is incredibly easy for engineering majors. The professor is someone I'd like to get to know better over the course of the next couple of years, so this is a good starting point. The only con of this class is that the social "sciences" people have taken over to the point where the class doesn't focus on as much math/physics/engineering.

sustainable engineering and practice...pretty awesome cuz i got an Aplus..i went to the lectures, there were guest lectureres and weekly (EASY) quizzes..then a final project and optional final....SO super easy..its ridiculous, and u learn a LOT! awesome class, take it if u need an A

this guys is horrible. I can barely type because he is SO frustrating. The assignments are VERY unclear and he never gives examples for them because he wants us to "learn & retain more". This is NOT a fun GE and he cant teach to non ee majors. Dont ever take him. Everything was really unorganized. He is just really frustrating. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS
renwable enrgy was an easy class if u go to all or most classes. assignments were fairly easy if you put some effort into them. A bit of work and an A is not hard to get.

Renewable Energy sources.  Horribly run class.  Gen Ed.  Is clear that Ali is a EE person and should not teach gen. eds!  He has no idea how to teach to a normal, non-ee audience.  Assignments were unclear, and class organisation is non-existant.  Sylabus is still not finalized (two weeks till finals)!

Great teacher!  Very thorough and very easy to understand.  He does a great job of anticipating potential problems students might have with a particular subject matter and preemptively addressing them. - Som
Ali is professional. A class with him is engineering pleasure.

Great teacher; takes a hard class and spends as much time as needed to make sure all students understand material.  Speaks clearly, draws neatly, and makes an intimidating class as easy as possible to learn well.
